article.title: Bounds for phylogenetic network space metrics

choices: A type of plant or bacteria
Software used to study the origin of genomes
Generalizations of phylogenetic trees that represent complex evolutionary histories
A specific type of graph with only degree 2 vertices

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the "tier" of a network?
choices: The number of edges in the network
The number of leaves in the network
The number of edges that need to be removed to turn the network into a phylogenetic tree
The number of cycles in the network

multiple_choice_question.text: What are the two main operations used to transform one network into another within the same tier?
choices: SPR and TBR operations
Blow-up and collapse operations
NNI and triangle operations
Cut-edge and blob operations
A type of phylogenetic network with specific structural properties
A simple network with no blobs
A network that is not pseudo-Hamiltonian
A phylogenetic tree with an even number of leaves

multiple_choice_question.text: What is a key property of a pseudo-Hamiltonian network?
choices: It has no cut-edges
It contains a cycle that passes through every non-leaf vertex
It can be transformed into any other network with the same number of leaves using only NNI operations
It has a diameter of at most n/2
